qas.question: What function does a "destination operating panel" feature?

answers.text: a passenger registers their floor calls before entering the car

qas.question: What is one benefit of a "destination operating panel"

answers.text: travel time is reduced as the elevator makes fewer stops for individual passengers

qas.question: What is another benefit of a "destination operating panel"?

answers.text: the computer distributes adjacent stops to different cars in the bank

qas.question: What is the downside to a :destination operating panel"?

answers.text: passenger waiting times may be longer as they will not necessarily be allocated the next car to depart

context: Some skyscraper buildings and other types of installation feature a destination operating panel where <a0_0>a passenger registers their floor calls before entering the car<a0_0/>. The system lets them know which car to wait for, instead of everyone boarding the next car. In this way, <a1_0>travel time is reduced as the elevator makes fewer stops for individual passengers<a1_0/>, and <a2_0>the computer distributes adjacent stops to different cars in the bank<a2_0/>. Although travel time is reduced, <a3_0>passenger waiting times may be longer as they will not necessarily be allocated the next car to depart<a3_0/>. During the down peak period the benefit of destination control will be limited as passengers have a common destination.
